dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c †Mohammad Rizwan b Haris Rauf 64 (87b 5x4 0x6 114m) SR: 73.56

dismissalComment.html: And Rauf gets the breakthrough! Mushfiqur looks to give charge to a length delivery outside off that was seaming away. Gets an edge that Rizwan grabs. Rizwan takes it just above head height but he is in pain now. He grabbed his left calf as he landed after taking that catch

dismissalText.long: c Fakhar Zaman b Faheem Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Fakhar Zaman b Faheem Ashraf 53 (57b 7x4 0x6 108m) SR: 92.98

dismissalComment.html: taken at deep backward square leg! Faheem breaks Shakib's resistance, and with that, the 100-run stand. Short of a length on middle, getting it to angle across to finish on off stump. Shakib went for the pull, but the bounce off the pitch didn't seem ideal enough for that. It just about got up to his stomach, but Shakib went ahead and found the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: return catch to Rauf! He strikes third ball, as the rapid pace of 140kph, and the hard length trouble Naim. Rauf went short and on a sharp line - around middle and off, enough to almost cramp the batter - as Naim tried to pull. But the line wasn't any wider for that shot, and the rapid pace meant the ball took the top edge, and went to where an imaginary short midwicket would have been. Rauf moved to his left, and took an easy catch

crashes into the stumps at 145kph! This just had the perfect combination of the right length, just enough movement, and rapid pace. Rauf angled this length delivery into the batter, pitching it on middle and off on that teasing length. Hridoy went for the flick, but seemed to have gone through a bit too early, while also being completely beaten by pace. The ball just about straightened, and smacked the middle and off stumps

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: And Rauf gets the breakthrough! Mushfiqur looks to give charge to a length delivery outside off that was seaming away. Gets an edge that Rizwan grabs. Rizwan takes it just above head height but he is in pain now. He grabbed his left calf as he landed after taking that catch

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalComment.html: Rauf has two in two! Length ball outside off, angling in ever so slightly. Taskin doesn't show much foot movement as he looks to drive and only manages a thin edge. Regulation take for Rizwan, who looks just fine now! Rauf on a hat-trick!

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: chipped to square leg first ball! Bangladesh's centurion from the last game falls without scoring today. And that, off a delivery which hardly deserved a wicket. Naseem went on the shorter side of a length, as the ball angled in on pitching, and ended on Mehidy's pads. He went for the clip, only to end up flicking to Fakhar at a comfortable height

headshotImage.caption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And he strikes right away! The short ball works for him as Afif goes for a pull. Takes a top edge and goes high in front and Faheem Ashraf runs across from mid-on to take that. That was short on off and seaming in to cramp him slightly

headshotImage.caption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And that will be that! Full on middle at 141 kph. Shoriful backs away and looks to drive it on the off side but misses completely. Naseem finishes with three, with Rauf missing out on a chance to complete his five-for. But he won't care. Pakistan have done brilliantly to bowl Bangladesh out for 193. And now, on to the batters!

dismissalText.long: c †Mohammad Rizwan b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c †Mohammad Rizwan b Shaheen Shah Afridi 16 (13b 4x4 0x6 17m) SR: 123.07

dismissalComment.html: edged behind! The extra bounce - and perhaps the short length - made the difference. There was movement and bounce, as Litton ended up fending to the keeper. Afridi bowled it quite short, getting it to angle across and end wide of off. Litton went flashing with a flat bat, while looking surprised by the bounce, only to tickle it to Rizwan

dismissalText.commentary: Shamim Hossain c Imam-ul-Haq b Iftikhar Ahmed 16 (23b 0x4 1x6 19m) SR: 69.56

dismissalComment.html: taken at square leg! The ball was sent up very high in the air, and Imam did well to keep his eyes on it even as Rizwan was approaching him. The ball was bowled short and quicker than his previous deliveries, as he also went on a stump-to-stump line this time. Shamim went hard with his attempted swing across the line, but ended up getting a top edge for a reverse-cup catch for Imam

commentTextItems.html: And they get the win with a cheeky reverse-sweep! Pakistan start the Super Fours with a win in Lahore, with more than ten overs to spare

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.45pm Quite a comprehensive win for Pakistan to start off the Super Fours. And sign off from the Pakistan leg of the tournament in style. Bangladesh will now face Sri Lanka on September 9 in Colombo where they will look to bounce back from this defeat and get some revenge against Sri Lanka. For today, that will be all from us. On behalf of Thilak, Ranjith and Himanshu (whose report summing up this game you can read here), this is Abhimanyu signing off. Goodnight everyone!

The player of the match is, as guessed by many of you, Haris Rauf: "It was hot but as a professional you have to manage these things. I've played quite a bit of cricket here. Home field. People here had expectations that we perform like this. So happy we won like this. We plan for any team as a bowling unit and discuss our roles. We try to execute the roles given to us. [On bowling back of length] On Lahore wickets you try to bowl stump-to-stump. I didn't go for the yorker as it wasn't needed. You have your goals in mind but you just keep working hard and try to give your best performance for the team."

Pakistan captain Babar Azam: "[On the fast bowlers] Credit to all the boys, especially the first ten overs. How they are bowling in the first ten overs and then Haris Rauf is also bowling really well. [On Faheem Ashraf] Yes we saw the games and fast bowlers were getting a little bit help and Faheem bowled really well. Winning always gives you confidence. [On the team feeling pressure] I don't think so. We are just giving our best in every match."
Irfan Rahman: "Surprised that Haris is not the MoM on a batting wicket". He still may be. It's not been announced yet. Imam just spoke pitch-side.
9.30pm We should have the presentation ceremony soon so don't go anywhere!

Imam-ul-Haq: "I would say not one of my fluent innings. We thought it was going to be a good batting wicket but it was seaming around so we were surprised but I have worked on my back foot game against spinners and I am happy with that. [On trying to score quicker for NRR] We discussed about it and we had a plan. We thought we can just chase in 36 overs and intentions were clear about it. We thought we had the chance and we were fortunate enough to close the match as early as possible. [On the pacers] They are remarkable and I just want them to bowl this way for the next two months."

Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan: "We lost early wickets in the start and we played some ordinary shots. On a wicket like this we shouldn't lose four wickets in the first ten overs, but it happens. Our partnership was good, thought we needed to bat 7-8 more overs. Very poor batting display on a surface like this but we have to move on to the next one. They are the no.1 team and these are the reasons. They have three world class bowlers who are making things easier for them. We have been doing well in the bowling department but batting is a bit hot and cold. We need to be more consistently. I thought our three seamers bowled brilliantly. Like Pakistan, our seamers have been bowling very well in the last couple of years. But unfortunately on a pitch like this you can't get wickets unless batters make mistakes. [On playing in SL] When I played in LPL, pitches were a bit slow, wickets were a little up and down and that should help us. So hopefully we will do well in Colombo."

9.20pm Pakistan took their time, but win comfortably in the end. Haris Rauf set it up with his excellent four-wicket haul, helped by Naseem who took three. Imam stayed steady despite a great opening spell from Shoriful, surviving quite a few lbw appeals. Fakhar, who started positively before slowing down, eventually was trapped lbw by Shoriful. Babar fell to Taskin soon, but Rizwan joined Imam and the two ensured Pakistan did not suffer any further hiccups. Imam got to a fine fifty and got out trying to up the tempo. By the time he departed for 78, Pakistan had the match in the bag. Rizwan got a well deserved half-century too.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Naim c & b Haris Rauf 20 (25b 4x4 0x6 40m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: return catch to Rauf! He strikes third ball, as the rapid pace of 140kph, and the hard length trouble Naim. Rauf went short and on a sharp line - around middle and off, enough to almost cramp the batter - as Naim tried to pull. But the line wasn't any wider for that shot, and the rapid pace meant the ball took the top edge, and went to where an imaginary short midwicket would have been. Rauf moved to his left, and took an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy b Haris Rauf 2 (9b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: crashes into the stumps at 145kph! This just had the perfect combination of the right length, just enough movement, and rapid pace. Rauf angled this length delivery into the batter, pitching it on middle and off on that teasing length. Hridoy went for the flick, but seemed to have gone through a bit too early, while also being completely beaten by pace. The ball just about straightened, and smacked the middle and off stumps

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: return catch to Rauf! He strikes third ball, as the rapid pace of 140kph, and the hard length trouble Naim. Rauf went short and on a sharp line - around middle and off, enough to almost cramp the batter - as Naim tried to pull. But the line wasn't any wider for that shot, and the rapid pace meant the ball took the top edge, and went to where an imaginary short midwicket would have been. Rauf moved to his left, and took an easy catch

crashes into the stumps at 145kph! This just had the perfect combination of the right length, just enough movement, and rapid pace. Rauf angled this length delivery into the batter, pitching it on middle and off on that teasing length. Hridoy went for the flick, but seemed to have gone through a bit too early, while also being completely beaten by pace. The ball just about straightened, and smacked the middle and off stumps

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: And Rauf gets the breakthrough! Mushfiqur looks to give charge to a length delivery outside off that was seaming away. Gets an edge that Rizwan grabs. Rizwan takes it just above head height but he is in pain now. He grabbed his left calf as he landed after taking that catch

dismissalText.commentary: Afif Hossain c Faheem Ashraf b Naseem Shah 12 (11b 0x4 1x6 18m) SR: 109.09

dismissalComment.html: And he strikes right away! The short ball works for him as Afif goes for a pull. Takes a top edge and goes high in front and Faheem Ashraf runs across from mid-on to take that. That was short on off and seaming in to cramp him slightly

videos.summary: He has Afif Hossain miscue a pull to mid-off

headshotImage.longCaption: Naseem Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shoriful Islam b Naseem Shah 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: And that will be that! Full on middle at 141 kph. Shoriful backs away and looks to drive it on the off side but misses completely. Naseem finishes with three, with Rauf missing out on a chance to complete his five-for. But he won't care. Pakistan have done brilliantly to bowl Bangladesh out for 193. And now, on to the batters!

dismissalComment.html: Oh huge appeal and the umpire waits and waits before finally giving it out! And Fakhar has reviewed it. Length ball on off angles in and Fakhar looks to flick but is beaten on the inside edge. And that's crashing into leg-stump so it's three reds and Shoriful does eventually get Fakhar!

headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam b Taskin Ahmed 17 (22b 1x4 0x6 33m) SR: 77.27

dismissalComment.html: bowled off the inside edge! There was a lack of bounce there too, to be fair, but it's a wicket nevertheless. Babar almost looked like reacting very late to this ball which was on the fuller side of a length just outside off, as it angled in. Thus, the ball came off the toe end of the bat, dropped just before the stumps, and went on to hit them. Perhaps the opening that could yet keep Bangladesh in the game

liveBlogStory.credit: Sreshth Shah is a sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo. @sreshthx
liveBlogStory.overviewHtml:
• The second round gets underway with Group A toppers Pakistan taking on Group B runners-up Bangladesh in Lahore. Catch the match preview to learn about the big picture and team changes.
  • The English ball-by-ball commentary of the game is available as usual.
  • So is commentary in Tamil.
  • You can check out our in-depth coverage of the Asia Cup right here.
